Zna se ko je gazda u Bersiju: Đoković uzeo 34. masters u karijeri i bacio Nadalu rukavicu u lice
Na završnom mastersu vodiće se odlučujuća borba za prvo mesto

03 Nov 2019

Gazda u Bersiju! Pariska dvorana je kao domaći teren za Novaka Đokovića, u kojoj je danas peti put u karijeri podigao šampionski pehar. Stari vuk je bio prejaka „zver“ za mladog lava Denisa Šapovalova, koji je dao sve od sebe, nervirao se, bacao reket, povremeno servirao kao iz topa, ali nije mogao da napravi nikakvu štetu (do sutra) najboljem teniseru sveta – 6:3, 6:4.
Osvojio je Novak danas 34. masters trofej u karijeri, sada mu rekorder Rafael Nadal beži za jedan. A, upravo će se njih dvojica obračunati na završnom mastersu u Londonu koji počinje za nedelju dana, za prvo mesto na kraju 2019. godine. Đoković mu je danas bacio rukavicu u lice, još da vidimo da li će Španac biti spreman za veliku borbu na Ostrvu.
Uzeo je Đoković danas i 77. krunu u karijeri, po čemu se izjednačio sa Džonom Mekinroom. Ali, godine igre su još pred srpskim asom i novi trofeji i rekordi. Jer, ako je suditi po tome kako je u Parizu pregazio „mlade lavove“ Stefanosa Cicipasa i Denisa Šapovalova, još je preveliki jaz između njih da bi Novak morao da strepi na najvećim turnirima.



Ceo meč je trajao nešto malo više od sat vremena, a proleteo je Đoković kroz prvi set za tačno pola sata! Kada je u drugom gemu napravio brejk, pa ga potvrdio i poveo sa 3:0, bilo je jasno da tu Šapovalov više nema šta da traži. Do kraja seta više nije bilo brejk prilika ni na jednoj strani, što znači da je Novak lagano „vozio“ do kraja, do 6:3 i do dobijanja prvog dela meča.
Očekivala se reakcija Kanađanina. Nije mogao baš tako lako da se preda u svom prvom masters finalu. Imao je Đoković brejk loptu u prvom gemu, ali se Šapovalov odbranio, podigao sebi samopouzdanje i počeo da igra u skladu sa važnošću meča. Sevali su asevi, napravio ih je sedam samo u tri svoja servis gema. Novak u tim trenucima nije imao ni šansu da zapreti brejk loptama.
Meč je prelomljen u sedmom gemu drugog seta. Šapovalova je „prodao“ prvi servis, a drugi mu je Đoković rešetao bez milosti. Dve brejk šanse, prva iskorišćena i srpski as je poveo 4:3, došao do tog gema koji rešava meč. Ispostavilo se da mu je najteži deo finala bio naredni gem, u kojem je Novak vodio 30:0 pa dopustio greškama rivalu da dođe do prve brejk šanse na meču. Uozbiljio se Đoković, „naštelovao“ ruku, odbio taj napad i u svom narednom servis gemu došao do pobede, do trofeja.
Foto: Reuters
text:
Who's boss in Bersi know: Djokovic took 34th career masters and threw Nadal's glove in his face
The final Masters will lead to a decisive first place fight

03 Nov 2019

Bersi boss! The Paris Hall is the home ground for Novak Djokovic, in which he raised the champion cup for the fifth time in his career. The Old Wolf was too big a "beast" for the young lion Denis Shapovalov, who did his best, getting nervous, throwing a racket, occasionally serving as a cannon, but could not do any harm (until tomorrow) to the best tennis player in the world - 6: 3: 6.
Novak won the 34th Masters Trophy of his career today, now record holder Rafael Nadal is running for one. And, just two of them will be counting on the final Masters in London starting in a week, for the first place at the end of 2019. Djokovic threw his glove in his face today, let's see if the Spaniard will be ready for a big fight on the Island.
He also took Djokovic today with his 77th career crown, equaling John McEnro. But the years of the game are still ahead of the Serbian ace and new trophies and records. For judging by the fact that he overtook the "young lions" of Stefanos Cicipas and Denis Shapovalov in Paris, it is still too big a gap between them that Novak would have to suffer in the biggest tournaments.



The whole match lasted just over an hour, and Djokovic flew through the first set in exactly half an hour! When he made a break in the second game, then confirmed it and led it with 3: 0, it was clear that Shapovalov had nothing to look for. By the end of the set there were no more break opportunities on either side, which means that Novak slowly "drove" until the end, until 6: 3 and until the first part of the match.
The reaction of the Canadian was expected. He couldn't have surrendered so easily in his first Masters final. He had Djokovic break the ball in the first game, but Shapovalov defended himself, raised his confidence and started playing in accordance with the importance of the match. They made aces, made seven in just three of their service games. In those moments, the rookie didn't even have a chance to hit the ball.
The match was broken in the seventh game of the second set. Shapovalov "sold" the first service, and the second Djokovic handled it without mercy. Two break chances, the first used and the Serbian ace led 4: 3, came up with that match-fixing game. It turned out that the hardest part of the finals was the next game, in which Novak led 30-0 and allowed the rival's mistakes to reach the first break of the match. Djokovic got serious, set his arm, repelled the attack and in his next service game won the trophy.
